meanings.definition: To make a hissing or sputtering sound
meanings.sent1: The firework fizzled in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The soda can fizzled when I opened it.
meanings.sent3: The frying pan sizzled and fizzled as I cooked breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The sparkler fizzled out, leaving a trail of light behind.
meanings.sent5: The candle fizzled as it burned down to the end.

meanings.sent1: The party fizzled out before midnight.
meanings.sent2: His plan to start a business fizzled due to lack of funding.
meanings.sent3: The joke fizzled with no one laughing at the punchline.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement fizzled when she realized the event was canceled.
meanings.sent5: The team's energy fizzled as they fell behind in the game.

meanings.definition: To fizzle out or fade away
meanings.sent1: The music gradually fizzled out as the party ended.
meanings.sent2: Her enthusiasm for the project fizzled away over time.
meanings.sent3: The hope for a snow day fizzled out when the sun came out.
meanings.sent4: The sound of laughter slowly fizzled away in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room fizzled out as the speaker droned on.
